question.text: Please refer to the employee handbook for further instructions relating ___ requests for vacation and personal leave.
Because so few people showed___for the meeting, we decided to postpone it to a later date.

answer.explanation: (D) “Show up” means “appear” or “arrive”. (A), (B), and (C) cannot be logically used in this sentence.

question.text: Please leave your luggage ___ the bus for loading.

answer.explanation: (D) “Beside” means “next to”. Choices (A) and (B) need more than one bus as a reference point. Choice (C) means “direction away”; it is not logical.

question.text: Mr. Camelio promises ___ the error right away.

answer.explanation: (C) “Promises” is followed by the infinitive. Choice (A) is the future tense. Choice (B) is the gerund. Choice (D) is the present tense.
(B) “Twice a day” can appear at the beginning or end of a sentence. Choice (A) links two events. Choices (C) and (D) should come between the auxiliary and main verb.

question.text: The bell captain suggested that more porters___hired.

answer.explanation: (C) The causative “suggest” is followed by the simple form of the verb. Choice (A) is the plural form. Choices (B) and (D) are simple forms, but are not logical.

question.text: The office is right___the street from the subway station.

answer.explanation: (B) “Across the street from” means “on the other side of the street”. Choices (A), (C), and (D) are not followed by “from”.

question.text: Baggage will not be ___ for check-in more than three hours before the departure of any Blue Skies Airline flight.

answer.explanation:
Accept st for st
No noun comes after the verb so we are using passive voice.

question.text: I___eat at expensive restaurants because I don’t have a lot of extra money.

answer.explanation: (D) “Seldom” means “almost never”. Choices (A), (B), and (C) are all opposite in meaning.

question.text: ___ it was late, Ms. Glaser stayed to finish her work.

answer.explanation: (A) The clauses contrast; use “although”. Choice (B) is not used with clauses. Choices (C) and (D) are not logical.
